intro: Cistus salviifolius f. brevipedunculatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and aromatic foliage. The plant produces clusters of pink or purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
